Package fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl

Class GraphParser

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.Parser
fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.NodeSetParser
fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.EdgeAndNodeSetParser
fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.GraphParser
public class GraphParser extends EdgeAndNodeSetParser

A parser for plain graphs.

This parser is initialised with a GraphTokenizer, i.e. it gobbles a list of tokens and spits out a Graph when asked for it. It is lazy, i.e. it will not do anything until asked for a graph, i.e. invoking the GraphParser.graph() method, and it will parse only once after initialisation. Further calls to .graph() return the already parsed graph.

Parsing is done in a single pass on the token list.

Options to setup the graph may be passed through graph-level properties in the file. These are found in NodeSetParser and EdgeAndNodeSetParser. The best way to go is to implement specific NodeFactory, EdgeFactory and PropertyListFactory which will implement which flavour of Node, Edge and property list (cf. PropertyListGetters descendants) should be used to construct the graph.

Allowed property types are those listed in ValidPropertyTypes. They can be specified as fully qualified java class names, or as simple strings as found in ValidPropertyTypes.

Note that the best use of this class is to hide it inside a GraphImporter.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 12 d√©c. 2018
